original_title: Better 3D Prints, Courtesy of a Simple Mass-Produced Bracket
original_content:
On the hack/not-a-hack scale, a 3D printed bracket for aluminum extrusions is  well, a little boring. Such connectors are nothing you couldnt buy, and even if you insisted on printing them instead, Printables and Thingiverse are full of ready-to-use designs. So why would you waste your precious time and effort rolling your own?
According to production 3D printing company [Slant 3D], a lot of times, we forget to take advantage of the special capabilities of 3D printing. The design progression of the L-bracket shown is a perfect example; it starts as a simple L, moves on to a more elaborate gusseted design, and eventually into a sturdy sold block design that would be difficult to make with injection molding thanks to shrinkage but is no problem for a 3D printer. Taking that a step further, the bracket morphs into a socketed design, taking advantage of what 3D printers can do by coming up with a part that reduces assembly time and fastener count while making a more finished, professional look.
Again, this isnt really about the bracket. Rather, its about a different way of thinking about your designs and leveraging the unique capabilities of 3D printers relative to other mass-production methods, like injection molding. Weve covered some of [Slant 3D]s high-volume design insights before, such as including living hinges and alternatives of pins and holes for assembling printed parts.
title: 3Dプリントを活用した特製のL型ブラケットの設計進化
body: 3Dプリンターは、他の大量生産方法に比べて独特な能力を活用することができます。例えば、縮縮できないブロックの設計や、組み立て時間と固定数を減らすための部品の設計などです。この記事では、3Dプリンターの特殊能力を活かす考え方について紹介されています。
titles: 3Dプリントを活用した特製のL型ブラケットの設計進化
3Dプリンターを使ったアセンブリ効率化のためのブラケットの開発
3Dプリントによる効率的なパーツ組み立てのためのソケット付きブラケットのデザイン
3Dプリントの独自性を活かしたブラケットの設計改良
3Dプリンターと射出成形の対比から考える、効率的なブラケットの設計アプローチ
